SEARCH

Class Validation

java.lang.Object
Validation
public final class Validation extends Object
Validation class Class has methods for validating different user-given inputs to match the correct form. Also two methods for different choices between simple Yes or No and more complex menu variant with different number of choices.

  • Method Details

    • isIDValid

      public static boolean isIDValid(String id)
      Method contains validation of the Finnish ID process. Method validates given String containing Finnish ID number by using regex pattern that contains - 6 digits (DDMMYY of birth) - separator a-zA-Z- (century of birth) - 3 digits (individual number; even for women, odd for men) - control character a-zA-Z0-9 and tested after using various IDs.
      Parameters:
      id - String to be validated using regex. Represents ID.
      Returns:
      isValid boolean, which tells if the inputted ID has passed or not.

    • isNameValid

      public static boolean isNameValid(String name)
      Method contains validation of the name process. Method validates given String containing name by using regex pattern that has only latin-letters and scandinavic characters. Doesn't pass any special characters, numbers etc. Also name must contain more than one character but isn't case sensitive.
      Parameters:
      name - String to be validated using regex. Represents name.
      Returns:
      isValid boolean, which tells if the inputted name has passed or not.

    • isPhoneValid

      public static boolean isPhoneValid(String phone)
      Method contains validation of the phone number process. Method validates given String containing phone number by using regex pattern that contains finnish phone code "+358" or "0" and the unique number starting with one digit from 1-9 and 8 digits after. Tested by multiple example variants.
      Parameters:
      phone - String to be validated using regex. Represents phone number.
      Returns:
      isValid boolean, which tells if the inputted phone number has passed or not.

    • isAddressValid

      public static boolean isAddressValid(String address)
      Method contains validation of the Finnish street address process. Method validates given String containing street address by using regex pattern that contains: - the street name with possible spaces and multiple words. - the number of the building with optionally followed with the entrance letter and apartment number (spaces allowed). - postal code (5 numbers in Finland). - town with any amount of letters but without spaces and special characters (Finland has only towns without spaces). Also has an option to input empty string.
      Parameters:
      address - String to be validated using regex. Represents address.
      Returns:
      isValid boolean, which tells if the inputted address has passed or not.

    • isEmailValid

      public static boolean isEmailValid(String email)
      Method contains validation of the e-mail process. Method validates given String containing e-mail by using regex pattern that contains the emails structure by using pattern that contains - at least one word character (which means any letter, digit or underscore) or dot or dash - '@' sign - at least one letter or dash - '.' and the last part of 2 to 3 letters and tested after by multiple example variants. Also has an option to input empty string.
      Parameters:
      email - String to be validated using regex. Represents e-mail.
      Returns:
      isValid boolean, which tells if the inputted email has passed or not.

    • validMenuChoice

      public static int validMenuChoice(int min, int max)
      Method contains a menu choice validation between given values. Method takes users input and checks if it is between the given min and max. If it is, returns that input, if not, asks for it again and specifies between which numbers the choice must be (if not understood) from the menu UI. Min and max are given when calling the method.
      Parameters:
      min - minimum value for the menu choice.
      max - maximum value for the menu choice.
      Returns:
      user given input value that has gone through validation.

    • choiceYesOrNo

      public static boolean choiceYesOrNo()
      Method contains the simple choice between Yes or No. Method asks for user input as long as it is either "y" or "n" and returns that as true or false for the simple Yes or No -menu question.
      Returns:
      boolean value of the choice between Yes or No. "y" = true, "n" = false.
